meanings.definition: The act of soaking food in a seasoned liquid before cooking.
meanings.sent1: The marinations of the chicken in a flavorful sauce made it tender and delicious.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy the marinations of meat in herbs and spices for a barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The marinations of the vegetables in a spicy marinade turned out to be a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her marinations of ideas in creativity led to a successful project presentation.
meanings.sent5: The marinations of memories in my mind brought back the joy of childhood summers.

meanings.sent1: The marinations of the steak in a special sauce took hours to infuse the flavors.
meanings.sent2: Proper marinations are essential for making the grilled chicken juicy and flavorful.
meanings.sent3: His marinations of jokes in his speech always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The marinations of music in her soul inspired her to become a talented musician.
meanings.sent5: The marinations of colors in the painting created a beautiful masterpiece.
